intro: Pleurospermum prattii, commonly known as the Pratt's pleurospermum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and adaptability to well-drained soils.
